Construction Management Phone: (718) 788-1366 Email: pjp284@nyu.edu  Office: 465 Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn, New York 11232  Profile  Biography Born 01-31-69 in Brooklyn, New York. Married, father of three.    Education City University of New York, Class of 2000 Ph.D., Civil Engineering  City College of CUNY, Class of 1993 M.E., Civil Engineering  Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute, Class of 1991 B.S., Civil Engineering  Experience El Sol Contracting & Construction Corporation Project Manager Gowanus Expressway / Prospect Expressway Interchange, Brooklyn, New York   Cross Bay Bridge Rehabilitation, Queens, New York   Serve as project manager, scheduler, and project engineer for the above $149 million $72 million bridge projects.   From: July 2007 to present Minuteman Construction Management LLC. President / Proprietor Serve as proprietor of independent consultant providing CPM Scheduling Services, Temporary Shielding and Shoring Design, Form-Work and False-Work Design, Scaffolding Design, Structural Lifting Plans and Computations, and Equipment Analysis for various clients.   From: March 2005 to present City College of New York Adjunct Professor Develop curriculum and instruct the following Undergraduate and Graduate courses:   * Construction Project Management   * Civil Engineering Management   * Highway Design and Engineering   * Traffic Engineering   * Flexible and Rigid Pavement Design   * Advanced Engineering Mathematics   From: January 1995 to present Conti Enterprises Project Manager Driscoll Bridge Rehabilitation, Keasbey, New Jersey   Serve as project manager, scheduler, and project engineer for the above $101 million bridge project.   From: May 2005 to June 2007 New York State Department of Transportation – Region 11 Construct Engineer In Charge / Civil Engineer II Serve as Resident Engineer on the following heavy / highway projects in the City of New York:   * Reconstruction of Route 9A – South Promenade - $70 million   * Rehabilitation of the Gowanus Expressway Viaduct - $40 million   * Rehabilitation of the I-278 Viaduct - $72 million   * Resurfacing of the Staten Island Expressway - $42 million   * Bridge Reconstruction on Route 440N - $10 million   * Cross Island Parkway / Linden Boulevard Interchange - $2 million   * Rehabilitation of the NYC West Side Piers - $5 million     From: May 1991 to May 2005  Authored + Edited Books Basic Highway Engineering   Basic Construction Engineering   Basic Bridge Design    Awards + Distinctions Deputy Chief Engineer’s Citation, NYSDOT Office of Construction May 2005.   Milton Pikarsky Award for Outstanding Graduate Student, CCNY, 1995.   Outstanding Achievement for Graduate Studies Citation, CCNY, 1993.   Affiliations American Society of Civil Engineers – Member   American Engineering Alliance – Member   Research Interests Construction Engineering   Construction Materials   Pavement Design and Mana   General / Collaborative Research Co-Investigator: R02005881 – Review and Development of Life-Cycle Cost and Network Analysis Procedures for NYSDOT Pavements. With N. A. Parker, CCNY, 1995 – 1996.   Author: A Life Cycle Cost Analysis Procedure for Selecting and Evaluating Durable Pavemetn Structures using SHRP-LTPP Mechanistic-Empiracle Relationships, CUNY, 2000.
